hexadecimal digits are arranged in groups of 8, 4, 4, 4, and 12 digits with hyphens between the groups. The can optionally be enclosed in matching braces.

Alternatively, the following format is permitted: {0xdddddddd,0xdddd, 0xdddd,{0xdd},{0xdd},{0xdd},{0xdd},{0xdd},{0xdd},{0xdd},{0xdd}}, where d is a hexadecimal digit. If this format is used, all brackets and commas indicated are required, and all numbers must be prefixed with "0x" as shown. Fewer hexadecimal digits than shown can be used, but not more.

remarks.para: The Parse method converts the string representation of a COMB to a value. This method can convert strings in any of the five formats produced by the and methods, as shown in the following table.

item.description: 32 digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in braces
32 digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in parentheses
Four hexadecimal values enclosed in braces, where the fourth value is a subset of eight hexadecimal values that is also enclosed in braces

remarks.para: The method throws a if it is unable to successfully parse the string. Some of the reasons why this might occur include:

item.description: contains characters that are not part of the hexadecimal character set.
has too many or too few numeric characters.
has too many or too few of the non-numeric characters appropriate for a particular format.
is not in one of the formats recognized by the method and listed in the previous table.

remarks.para: Use the method to catch any unsuccessful parse operations without having to handle an exception.

returns.para: The value of this , formatted by using the "D" format specifier as follows:

where the value of the GUID is represented as a series of lowercase hexadecimal digits in groups of 8, 4, 4, 4, and 12 digits and separated by hyphens. An example of a return value is "382c74c3-721d-4f34-80e5-57657b6cbc27". To convert the hexadecimal digits from a through f to uppercase, call the method on the returned string.

member.name: M:Cadru.Comb.ToString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the value of this instance, according to the provided format specifier.
member.param: A single format specifier that indicates how to format the value of this . The format parameter can be "N", "D", "B", "P", or "X". If is or an empty string (""), "D" is used.
member.returns: The value of this , represented as a series of lowercase hexadecimal digits in the specified format.
member.exception: The value of is not , an empty string (""), "N", "D", "B", "P", or "X".
member.remarks:
The following table shows the accepted format specifiers for the parameter. "0" represents a digit; hyphens ("-"), braces ("{", "}"), and parentheses ("(", ")") appear as shown.
Specifier Format of return value
N
32 digits:
00000000000000000000000000000000
D
32 digits separated by hyphens:
00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
B
32 digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in braces:
{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}
P
32 digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in parentheses:
(00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000)
X
Four hexadecimal values enclosed in braces, where the fourth value is a subset of eight hexadecimal values that is also enclosed in braces:
{0x00000000,0x0000,0x0000,{0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00}}
The hexadecimal digits a through f are lowercase in the returned string. To convert them to uppercase, call the method on the returned string.

member.name: M:Cadru.Extensions.DateTimeExtensions.TryParseFromSerialDate(System.Double,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Converts the specified floating-point number into its equivalent and returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the value equivalent to the date and time contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if does not contain a valid floating-point representation of a date and time. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: if the s parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, .

remarks.para: The d parameter is a double-precision floating-point number that represents a date as the number of days before or after the base date, midnight, 30 December 1899. The sign and integral part of d encode the date as a positive or negative day displacement from 30 December 1899, and the absolute value of the fractional part of d encodes the time of day as a fraction of a day displacement from midnight. d must be a value between negative 657435.0 through positive 2958465.99999999.

Note that because of the way dates are encoded, there are two ways of representing any time of day on 30 December 1899. For example, -0.5 and 0.5 both mean noon on 30 December 1899 because a day displacement of plus or minus zero days from the base date is still the base date, and a half day displacement from midnight is noon.

member.name: T:Cadru.Globalization.LocalizableString
member.summary: A helper class for providing a localizable string property.

member.name: M:Cadru.Globalization.LocalizableString.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a localizable string, specifying the property name associated with this item. The value will be used within any exceptions thrown as a result of localization failures.
member.param: The name of the property being localized. This name will be used within exceptions thrown as a result of localization failures.

member.name: P:Cadru.Globalization.LocalizableString.ResourceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the resource type to be used for localization.

member.name: P:Cadru.Globalization.LocalizableString.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of this localizable string. This value can be either the literal, non-localized value, or it can be a resource name found on the resource type supplied to .

member.name: M:Cadru.Globalization.LocalizableString.GetLocalizableValue
member.summary: Gets the potentially localized value.
member.remarks:
If has been specified and is not null, then localization will occur and the localized value will be returned.
If is null then will be returned as a literal, non-localized string.
member.exception: Thrown if localization fails. This can occur if has been specified, is not null, but the resource could not be accessed. must be a public class, and must be the name of a public static string property that contains a getter.
member.returns: Returns the potentially localized value.

member.name: M:Cadru.Globalization.LocalizableString.ClearCache
member.summary: Clears any cached values, forcing to perform evaluation.

member.name: T:Cadru.Text.NormalizationOptions
member.summary: Options used by the methods to determine how to normalize a string.

member.name: F:Cadru.Text.NormalizationOptions.None
member.summary: Do not remove any characters from the string.

member.name: F:Cadru.Text.NormalizationOptions.ControlCharacters
member.summary: Remove all control characters from the string.

member.name: F:Cadru.Text.NormalizationOptions.Whitespace
member.summary: Remove all white space characters from the beginning and end of the string and collapse all internal white space characters to a single white space character.

member.name: F:Cadru.Text.NormalizationOptions.All
member.summary: Remove all white space and control characters from the beginning and end of the string and collapse all internal white space characters to a single white space character.

member.name: T:Cadru.Text.NumericComparisonOptions
member.summary: Specifies the comparison rules to be used by certain overloads of the StringExtensions.LengthBetween and NumericExtensions.Between methods.

member.name: F:Cadru.Text.NumericComparisonOptions.None
member.summary: The comparison includes neither the minimum and maximum value.

member.name: F:Cadru.Text.NumericComparisonOptions.IncludeMinimum
member.summary: The comparison includes the minimum value.

member.name: F:Cadru.Text.NumericComparisonOptions.IncludeMaximum
member.summary: The comparison includes the maximum value.

member.name: F:Cadru.Text.NumericComparisonOptions.IncludeBoth
member.summary: The comparison includes both the minimum and maximum value.

member.name: T:Cadru.UnixTimestamp
member.summary: Represents an instant in time, defined as the number of seconds that have elapsed since 00:00:00 Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), Thursday, 1 January 1970, not counting leap seconds.
member.remarks: The date and time range that can be represented by a is constrained to the same date and time range as .

member.name: F:Cadru.UnixTimestamp.MaxValue
member.summary: Represents the largest possible value of . This field is read-only.
member.remarks: The value of this constant is equivalent to 23:59:59, December 31, 9999.

member.name: F:Cadru.UnixTimestamp.MinValue
member.summary: Represents the smallest possible value of . This field is read-only.
member.remarks: The value of this constant is equivalent to 00:00:00, January 01, 0001.
